Articles.Content:
Hey guys, I’ve been playing KSP for a while (probably 250 hours total) but I’ve never really engaged in the community!

I’ll just say a little bit of stuff about my experience with KSP so far!

The mods that I always use are Kerbal Engineer Redux, Kerbal Alarm Clock, FMRS, and Trajectories (if there are any more mods that are helpful but don’t break the game please send ‘me my way.)

Right now I’m trying to play through a vanilla career game on Hard with the mods mentioned above. I really didn’t realize how much I rely on saving/loading until I suddenly couldn’t. Suffice to say I’ve been using a lot more probes and adding a lot of parachutes (might even use a launch escape system once I unlock one.) Sadly, I lost Jeb while testing an airplane to do pressure surveys (y’all know the grind.) Valentina Kerman just hasn’t been able to fill the void in my life left behind after the accident. Now, I put separatroms, parachutes, and decouplers on my planes around the cockpit just in case I ever need to eject. If only I’d taken these measures sooner, Jeb would still be with us. Anyway, right now I’m saving up money to upgrade the VAB so I can send a rocket safely to the moon. I designed a rocket with enough Delta-V, but I don’t have enough parts to go around for struts and stabilizers, so I fear a catastrophic failure (which would cost a nice $20,000 in losses and maybe another life.) I’m going to keep testing components, hauling em into orbit, ferrying tourists around Kerbin, and conducting observations in my ultra-safe jet.

I can’t say that I have done anything too momentous in the game, although I’ve played around with challenges and mods. One challenge that stands out for me was one to travel to the Mun’s surface and back for the smallest cost. I wound up with a rocket that cost only 4,975 and although it was a little ugly, it worked. Re-entry was a little rough, as the re-entry vehicle consisted of a small radiator, an external seat, a battery pack, and a control wheel. He still survived. 

 

Ok, I’m rambling and I’m sorry.

It’s nice to meet you all. I hope to be able to uhhh contribute to these forums in some capacity.

-Asteroidman
